Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives
Mary Engelberg Movie Script for The Winner TAM 242
0.25 Linear Feet in 1 manuscript box.
undated The collection consists of the one movie script by Mary Engelberg entitled The Winner. The movie begins in 1936 in Monessen, PA, and chronicles the rise of a corrupt union official. Materials are in English. 1
Conditions Governing Access
Materials are open without restrictions.
Immediate Source of Acquisition
Donated by Mary Engelberg in 1995. The accession number associated with this gift is 1995.021.
Historical/Biographical Note
Mary Engelberg, aka Mary Engel, was the author of a labor-themed movie script/screenplay.
Preferred Citation
Published citations should take the following form:
Identification of item, date; Mary Engelberg Movie Script for The Winner; TAM.242; Box 1; Folder 1; Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.
Scope and Contents note
Consists of The Winner, a movie script/screenplay (114 pp.) It begins in 1936 in a union hall, in Monessen, PA (the local union represents workers at the "Spartacus Tin Plate Company"). It concludes years later with union corruption and murder, with the word "winner" in the title apparently referring to a corrupt union official who rose out of the rank and file.
Conditions Governing Use
Any rights (including copyright and related rights to publicity and privacy) held by Mary Engelberg were transferred to New York University in 1995 by Mary Engelberg. Permission to publish or reproduce materials in this collection must be secured from the Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archive. Please contact tamiment.wagner@nyu.edu.
